</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">The Company&#8217;s Borrowing Base under its Credit 
Facility may be reduced by the lender</font>.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The borrowing base under the Company&#8217;s revolving 
credit facility will be determined from time to time by the lender, consistent 
with its customary natural gas and crude oil lending practices. Reductions in 
estimates of the Company&#8217;s natural gas and crude oil reserves could result
in a reduction in the Company&#8217;s borrowing base, which would reduce the 
amount of financial resources available under the Company&#8217;s revolving 
credit facility to meet its capital requirements. Such a reduction could be the 
result of lower commodity prices or production, inability to drill or 
unfavorable drilling results, changes in natural gas and crude oil reserve 
engineering, the lender&#8217;s inability to agree to an adequate borrowing base
or adverse changes in the lenders&#8217; practices regarding estimation of 
reserves.&#160; If cash flow from operations or the Company&#8217;s borrowing 
base decreases for any reason, the Company&#8217;s ability to undertake 
exploration and development activities could be adversely affected.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As a result, the Company&#8217;s ability to replace 
production may be limited. In addition, if the borrowing base is reduced, the 
Company may be required to pay down its borrowings under the revolving credit 
facility so that outstanding borrowings do not exceed the reduced borrowing 
base. This requirement could further reduce the cash available to the Company 
for capital spending and, if the Company did not have sufficient capital to 
reduce its borrowing level, could cause the Company to default under its 
revolving credit facility.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" 
id="DSPFPageNumber">17</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><a style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" 
href="#TABLEOFCONTENTS">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of June 30, 2016, the Company&#8217;s borrowing base
was approximately $3.2 million of which $2.3 million had been drawn down by the 
Company.&#160; The Company&#8217;s next periodic borrowing base review will take
place in August 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Commodity Risk</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company's major market risk exposure is in the 
pricing applicable to its oil production.&#160; Realized pricing is primarily 
driven by the prevailing worldwide price for crude oil.&#160; Historically, 
prices received for oil and gas production have been volatile and unpredictable 
and price volatility is expected to continue.&#160; Monthly Kansas oil prices 
received during the first six months of 2016 ranged from a low of $24.50 per 
barrel to a high of $43.02 per barrel.&#160; As a result of the low prices 
experienced during 2015 and 2016, the Company recorded an impairment of its oil 
and gas properties during the quarter ended March 31, 2016 and the quarter ended
June 30, 2016.&#160; The Company anticipates it may need to record an additional
impairment during the quarter ended September 30, 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of June 30, 2016, the Company has no open positions 
related to derivative agreements relating to commodities.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Interest Rate Risk</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2016, the Company had debt outstanding of 
$2.45 million including, as of that date, $2.3 million owed on its credit 
facility with Prosperity Bank. As of June 30, 2016, the interest rate on the 
credit facility was variable at a rate equal to prime plus 0.50% per 
annum.&#160; The Company&#8217;s credit facility interest rate at June 30, 2016 
was 4.00%.&#160; The Company&#8217;s remaining debt of $133,000 has fixed 
interest rates ranging from 4.16% to 4.60%.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The annual impact on interest expense and the 
Company&#8217;s cash flows of a 10% increase in the interest rate on the credit 
facility would be approximately $9,000 assuming borrowed amounts under the 
credit facility remained at the same amount owed as of June 30, 2016.&#160; The 
Company did not have any open derivative contracts relating to interest rates at
June 30, 2016 or December 31, 2015.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Forward-Looking Statements and 
Risk</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Certain statements in this report, including statements
of the future plans, objectives, and expected performance of the Company, are 
forward-looking statements that are dependent upon certain events, risks and 
uncertainties that may be outside the Company&#8217;s control, and which could 
cause actual results to differ materially from those anticipated. Some of these 
include, but are not limited to, the market prices of oil and gas, economic and 
competitive conditions, inflation rates, legislative and regulatory changes, 
financial market conditions, political and economic uncertainties of foreign 
governments, future business decisions, and other uncertainties, all of which 
are difficult to predict.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There are numerous uncertainties inherent in projecting
future rates of production and the timing of development expenditures. The total
amount or timing of actual future production may vary significantly from 
estimates. The drilling of exploratory wells can involve significant risks, 
including those related to timing, success rates and cost overruns. Lease and 
rig availability, complex geology and other factors can also affect these 
risks.&#160; Additionally, fluctuations in oil and gas prices, or a prolonged 
period of low prices, may substantially adversely affect the Company's financial
position, results of operations, and cash flows.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" 
id="DSPFPageNumber">18</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><a style="FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal"

<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left">

4.</font></td>

<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Evaluation of Disclosure Controls 
and Procedures</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief 
Financial Officer has evaluated the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s 
disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) 
and 15d-15(e)). Based on such evaluation, the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive 
Officer and Chief Financial Officer has concluded that the Company&#8217;s 
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this 
Report, were adequate and effective to provide reasonable assurance that 
information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports that it files or 
submits under the Exchange Act, is recorded, processed, summarized and reported,
within the time periods specified in the SEC&#8217;s rules and forms. The 
effectiveness of a system of disclosure controls and procedures is subject to 
various inherent limitations, including cost limitations, judgments used in 
decision making, assumptions about the likelihood of future events, the 
soundness of internal controls, and fraud. Due to such inherent limitations, 
there can be no assurance that any system of disclosure controls and procedures 
will be successful in preventing all errors or fraud, or in making all material 
information known in a timely manner to the appropriate levels of 
management.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the quarter ended December 31, 2015, the 
Company&#8217;s management determined that the Company&#8217;s controls over 
review of the quarterly ceiling test calculation were not adequate to ensure 
this calculation was performed correctly.&#160; Based on this material weakness,
the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer 
concluded that the Company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures, as of 
December 31, 2015 were not adequate and effective to provide reasonable 
assurance that information required to be disclosed by the Company in reports 
that it files or submits under the Exchange Act, is recorded, processed, 
summarized and reported, within the time periods specified in the SEC&#8217;s 
rules and forms.&#160; During the quarter ended March 31, 2016, the
Company&#8217;s management addressed this material weakness by implementing a 
process to more fully analyze the impact of the Company&#8217;s tax position on 
its quarterly ceiling test calculation.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Changes in Internal Controls</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the quarter ended March 31, 2016, the Company 
implemented a process to more fully analyze the impact of the Company&#8217;s 
tax position on its quarterly ceiling test calculation.&#160; Other than this 
process, there have been no other changes to the Company&#8217;s system of 
internal controls over financial reporting that have materially affected, or are
reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company&#8217;s system of controls 
over financial reporting.&#160; As part of a continuing effort to improve the 
Company&#8217;s business processes, management is evaluating its internal 
controls and may update certain controls to accommodate any modifications to its
business processes or accounting procedures.</div>
<div><br>

<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>
<!--Licensed to: Summit Financial Printing, LLC
    Document created using EDGARfilings PROfile 4.1.1.0
    Copyright 1995 - 2016 Summit Financial Printing, LLC.  All rights 
reserved.-->
</head>
<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" bgcolor="#ffffff" 
text="#000000">
<div>
<hr style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; HEIGHT: 4px; COLOR: 
#000000; MARGIN-LEFT: auto; MARGIN-RIGHT: auto" align="center" 
noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Exhibit 31&#160;&#160; CERTIFICATION</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">I, Michael J. Rugen, certify that:</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1.&#160; I have reviewed this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Tengasco, 
Inc. for the quarter ended June 30, 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.&#160; Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue 
statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make 
the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements 
were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this 
report;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">3.&#160; Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other 
information included in this annual report, fairly present in all material
respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the 
registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">4.&#160; The registrant&#8217;s certifying officers are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial 
reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-(f) for the 
registrant and we have:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160; designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or 
caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our 
supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, 
including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within 
those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being 
prepared;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160; designed such internal control over financial 
reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be 
designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the 
reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements 
for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting 
principles;</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160; evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s
disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions 
about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end
of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160; disclosed in this report any change in the 
registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred 
during the registrant&#8217;s most recent fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s
fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially 
affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s 
internal control over financial reporting; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">5.&#160; The Registrant&#8217;s certifying officers have disclosed, based 
on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to 
the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the registrant's board of 
directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160; All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses 
in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which 
are reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, 
process, summarize and report financial information; and</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160; Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves 
management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's 
internal control over financial reporting.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="zbfca8d972c7c4560ae4f9afb6a59583a" border="0" 
cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top" colspan="2">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">Dated: August 12, 2016</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 4%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">By:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 90%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-VARIANT: normal; FONT-STYLE: normal; FONT-
FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal"><u>/s/ Michael 
J. Rugen</u></div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 6%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>

the quarter ended June 30, 2016.</div>

Roman'; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">To the best of my knowledge this Quarterly Report on 
Form 10-Q (i) fully complies with the requirements of section 13(a) or 15(d) of 
the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78m (a) or 78o (d)); and, 
(ii) the information contained in this Report fairly present, in all material 
respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Tengasco, Inc.
and its subsidiaries during the period covered by this report.</div>

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company recorded
depletion expense of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$583,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; and 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$1,360,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; for the six months 
ended June 30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition, 
during the six months ended June 30, 2016, the Company recorded an impairment of
oil and gas properties in the amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;$2,086,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; impairment of 
oil and gas properties was recorded during the six months ended June 30, 
2015.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As a result of the ceiling test impairment, the 
accumulated depreciation, depletion, and amortization has been netted against 
the cost to reflect the post impairment value of the oil and gas 
properties.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
(7)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
weight:bold;"&gt;Asset Retirement Obligation&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Our asset retirement
obligations represent the estimated present value of the amount we will incur to
plug, abandon, and remediate our producing properties at the end of their 
productive lives in accordance with applicable laws. The following table 
summarizes the Company&amp;#x2019;s Asset Retirement Obligation transactions for
the six months ended June 30, 2016 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-style:italic;"&gt;(in thousands)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt;:&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The accompanying
unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared in 
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of
America (&amp;#x201C;U.S. GAAP&amp;#x201D;) for interim financial information 
and with the instructions to Form 10-Q and Item 210 of Regulation S-X. 
Accordingly, they do not include all of the information and footnotes required 
by U.S. GAAP for complete financial statements, although the Company believes 
that the disclosures made are adequate to make the information not misleading. 
In the opinion of management, all adjustments (consisting of only normal 
recurring accruals) considered necessary for a fair presentation for the periods
presented have been included as required by Regulation S-X, Rule 10-
01.&amp;nbsp; Operating results for the six months ended June 30, 2016 are not 
necessarily indicative of the results that may be expected for the year ended 
December 31, 2016. It is suggested that these condensed consolidated financial 
statements be read in conjunction with the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated 
financial statements and footnotes thereto included in the Company&amp;#x2019;s 
Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Basis of
Presentation&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
<us-gaap:BusinessDescriptionAndAccountingPoliciesTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;
(1)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;D&lt;/font&gt;&lt;a name="Notes"&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;escription of Business and 
Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Tengasco, Inc. (the 
&amp;#x201C;Company&amp;#x201D;) is a Delaware corporation.&amp;nbsp; The 
Company is in the business of exploration for and production of oil and natural 
gas.&amp;nbsp; The Company&amp;#x2019;s primary area of exploration and 
production is in Kansas.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company&amp;#x2019;s
wholly-owned subsidiary, Manufactured Methane Corporation 
(&amp;#x201C;MMC&amp;#x201D;) operates a treatment facility for the extraction 
of methane gas from nonconventional sources for eventual sale to natural gas 
customers or generation of electricity.&amp;nbsp; This facility is located at 
the Carter Valley landfill site in Church Hill, Tennessee.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Basis of
Presentation&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The accompanying
unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared in 
accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States of
America (&amp;#x201C;U.S. GAAP&amp;#x201D;) for interim financial information 
and with the instructions to Form 10-Q and Item 210 of Regulation S-X. 
Accordingly, they do not include all of the information and footnotes required 
by U.S. GAAP for complete financial statements, although the Company believes 
that the disclosures made are adequate to make the information not misleading. 
In the opinion of management, all adjustments (consisting of only normal 
recurring accruals) considered necessary for a fair presentation for the periods
presented have been included as required by Regulation S-X, Rule 10-
01.&amp;nbsp; Operating results for the six months ended June 30, 2016 are not 
necessarily indicative of the results that may be expected for the year ended 
December 31, 2016. It is suggested that these condensed consolidated financial 
statements be read in conjunction with the Company&amp;#x2019;s consolidated 
financial statements and footnotes thereto included in the Company&amp;#x2019;s 
Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
weight:bold;"&gt;Principles of Consolidation&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The accompanying
condensed consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company 
and its wholly-owned subsidiaries after elimination of all significant 
intercompany transactions and balances.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Use of
Estimates&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
weight:bold;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The accompanying
consolidated financial statements are prepared in conformity with U.S. GAAP 
which requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the 
reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the dates of the financial 
statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the 
reporting periods.&amp;nbsp; Significant estimates include reserve quantities 
and estimated future cash flows associated with proved reserves, which 
significantly impact depletion expense and potential impairment of oil and 
natural gas properties, income taxes and the valuation of deferred tax assets, 
stock-based compensation and commitments and contingencies.&amp;nbsp; We analyze
our estimates based on historical experience and other assumptions that we 
believe to be reasonable. While we believe that our estimates and assumptions 
used in preparation of the consolidated financial statements are appropriate, 
actual results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Revenue
Recognition&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Revenues are recognized 
based on actual volumes of oil, natural gas, methane, and electricity sold to 
purchasers at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery has occurred and 
title has transferred, and collectability is reasonably assured.&amp;nbsp; Crude
oil is stored and at the time of delivery to the purchasers, revenues are 
recognized.&amp;nbsp; There were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; natural gas 
imbalances at June 30, 2016 or December 31, 2015.&amp;nbsp; Methane gas and 
electricity sales meters are located at the Carter Valley landfill site and any 
sales of methane or electricity are billed each month.&amp;nbsp; 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt; methane gas was sold during the six months ended 
June 30, 2016 or 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
Cash Equivalents&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Cash and
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Cash and cash equivalents
include temporary cash investments with a maturity of ninety days or less at 
date of purchase.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
weight:bold;"&gt;Inventory&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
weight:bold;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Inventory consists of
crude oil in tanks and is carried at lower of cost or market value.&amp;nbsp; 
The cost component of the oil inventory is calculated using the average cost per
barrel for the three months ended June 30, 2016 and December 31, 
2015.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;These costs include production costs and taxes, 
allocated general and administrative costs, depreciation, and allocated interest
cost.&amp;nbsp; The market component is calculated using the average June 2016 
and December 2015 oil sales prices received from the Company&amp;#x2019;s Kansas
properties.&amp;nbsp; In addition, the Company also carries equipment and 
materials in inventory to be used in its Kansas operation which are carried at 
the lower of cost or market value.&amp;nbsp; The cost component of the equipment
and materials inventory represents the original cost paid for the equipment and 
materials.&amp;nbsp; The market component is based on estimated sales value for 
similar equipment and materials as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 
2015.&amp;nbsp; The following table sets forth information concerning the 
Company&amp;#x2019;s inventory &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;font-style:italic;"&gt;(in thousands)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt;:&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
1pt"&gt;
size:1pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
&lt;/p&gt;

left:0pt;"&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:center;font-
weight:bold;font-size:8pt;"&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
&lt;/td&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New

&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:10.90%;border-
top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double 
#000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;;font-

#D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: 
#CCEEFF;padding:0pt;"&gt;
Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.56%;border-
top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double

Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:10.86%;border-
top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double 
#000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: #CCEEFF;;font-
family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right;" 
nowrap="nowrap"&gt;542&amp;nbsp;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Full
Cost Method of Accounting&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company follows the
full cost method of accounting for oil and gas property acquisition, 
exploration, and development activities.&amp;nbsp; Under this method, all costs 
incurred in connection with acquisition, exploration, and development of oil and
gas reserves are capitalized.&amp;nbsp; Capitalized costs include lease 
acquisition costs, seismic related costs, certain internal exploration costs, 
drilling, completion, and estimated asset retirement costs. The capitalized 
costs of oil and gas properties, plus estimated future development costs 
relating to proved reserves and estimated asset retirement costs which are not 
already included net of estimated salvage value, are amortized on the unit-of-
production method based on total proved reserves. The Company has determined its
reserves based upon reserve reports provided by LaRoche Petroleum Consultants 
Ltd.&amp;nbsp; The costs of unproved properties are excluded from amortization 
until the properties are evaluated, subject to an annual assessment of whether 
impairment has occurred.&amp;nbsp; The Company had unevaluated properties of 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;$552,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt; at June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015.&amp;nbsp; 
Proceeds from the sale of oil and gas properties are accounted for as reductions
to capitalized costs unless such sales cause a significant change in the 
relationship between costs and the estimated value of proved reserves, in which 
case a gain or loss is recognized.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;At the end of each
reporting period, the Company performs a &amp;#x201C;ceiling test&amp;#x201D; on
the value of the net capitalized cost of oil and gas properties. This test 
compares the net capitalized cost (capitalized cost of oil and gas properties, 
net of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization and related deferred
income taxes) to the present value of estimated future net revenues from oil and
gas properties using an average price (arithmetic average of the beginning of 
month prices for the prior 12 months) and current cost discounted at 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;10%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt; plus cost of properties not being amortized and the
lower of cost or estimated fair value of unproven properties included in the 
cost being amortized (ceiling).&amp;nbsp; If the net capitalized cost is greater
than the ceiling, a write-down or impairment is required.&amp;nbsp; A write-down
of the carrying value of the asset is a non-cash charge that reduces earnings in
the current period.&amp;nbsp; Once incurred, a write-down cannot be reversed in 
a later period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;During the three months and six months ended 
June 30, 2016, the Company recorded an impairment of oil and gas properties in 
the amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$1,445,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; and 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$2,086,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;, 
respectively.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; impairment of 
oil and gas properties were recorded during the three months and six months 
ended June 30, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
Receivable&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Accounts
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-
weight:bold;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Accounts receivable
consist of uncollateralized joint interest owner obligations due within 30 days 
of the invoice date, uncollateralized accrued revenues due under normal trade 
terms, generally requiring payment within 30 days of production, and other 
miscellaneous receivables. No interest is charged on past-due balances. Payments
made on accounts receivable are applied to the earliest unpaid items. We review 
accounts receivable periodically and reduce the carrying amount by a valuation 
allowance that reflects our best estimate of the amount that may not be 
collectible. An allowance was recorded at June 30, 2016 and December 31, 
2015.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The following table sets
forth information concerning the Company&amp;#x2019;s accounts receivable 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;font-style:italic;"&gt;(in 
thousands)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;:&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 1pt"&gt;
size:1pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-

contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Cash and
Cash Equivalents&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Cash and cash equivalents
include temporary cash investments with a maturity of ninety days or less at 
date of purchase.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingencies xsi:nil="true" 
contextRef="As_Of_6_30_2016" unitRef="Unit12" />
  <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
(11)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Commitments and Contingencies&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company as designated
operator was administratively issued an &amp;#x201C;Incident of Non-
Compliance&amp;#x201D; by BSEE during the quarter ended September 30, 2012 
concerning &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;one&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; of 
Hoactzin&amp;#x2019;s properties.&amp;nbsp; This action calls for payment of a 
civil penalty of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$386,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; for failure to 
provide, upon request, documentation to the BSEE evidencing that certain safety 
inspections and tests had been conducted in 2011.&amp;nbsp; In the 4th quarter 
of 2012, the Company filed an administrative appeal with the Interior Board of 
Land Appeals (&amp;#x201C;IBLA&amp;#x201D;) of this action in order to attempt 
to significantly reduce the civil penalty.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp; This appeal 
required a fully collateralized appeal bond to postpone the payment obligation 
until the appeal was determined.&amp;nbsp; The Company posted and collateralized
this bond with RLI Insurance Company.&amp;nbsp; If the bond was not posted, the 
appeal would have been administratively denied and the order to the Company as 
operator to pay the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$386,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; penalty would have 
become final.&amp;nbsp; On June 23, 2014, the IBLA affirmed the civil penalty 
without reduction.&amp;nbsp; On September 22, 2014, the Company sought judicial 
review of the June 23, 2014 agency action in the federal district court in the 
Eastern District of Louisiana at New Orleans.&amp;nbsp; On July 14, 2015, the 
court affirmed the determination by the IBLA without 
reduction.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company determined that further appeal of the 
determination was not likely to reduce the penalty and the Company did not 
further appeal.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In the third quarter of 2015, the Company 
paid the civil penalty affirmed on appeal and statutory interest thereon from 
funds borrowed under its credit facility.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company has not
advanced any funds to pay any obligations of Hoactzin and no borrowing 
capability of the Company has been used in connection with its obligations under
the Management Agreement, except for those funds used to pay the civil penalty 
and interest thereon.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display:
inline;color:#000000;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;During the second quarter
of 2015, the Company received from Hoactzin a copy of an internal analysis 
prepared by Hoactzin setting out certain issues that Hoactzin may consider to 
form the basis of operational and other claims against the Company primarily 
under the Management Agreement.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This analysis raised issues 
other than the &amp;#x201C;Incident of Non-Compliance&amp;#x201D; discussed 
above.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The Company is discussing this analysis, as well as 
the civil penalty discussed above, with Hoactzin in an effort to determine 
whether there is possibility of a reasonable resolution of some or all of these 
matters on a negotiated basis.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Cost
Reduction Measures&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Commencing in the quarter
ended March 31, 2015 and continuing through the quarter ended June 30, 2016, the
Company implemented cost reduction measures including compensation reductions 
for each employee as well as members of the Board of Directors.&amp;nbsp; These 
compensation reductions will remain in place until such time, if any, that the 
market price of crude oil, calculated as a thirty day trailing average of WTI 
postings as published by the U.S. Energy Information Administration meets or 
exceeds &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$70&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; per barrel when 
compensation shall revert to the levels in place before the reductions became 
effective. At such time, if any, that the market price of crude oil, calculated 
as a thirty day trailing average of WTI postings as published by the U.S. Energy
Information Administration meets or exceeds &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt;$85&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt; per barrel, all previous reductions made will be reimbursed, a 
portion which may be paid in stock, to each employee and members of the Board of
Directors if he is still employed by the Company or still a member of the Board 
of Directors.&amp;nbsp; As of June 30, 2016, the reductions were approximately 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;$162,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt;.&amp;nbsp; The Company has not accrued any 
liabilities associated with these compensation reductions.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

and its wholly-owned subsidiaries after elimination of all significant

#CCEEFF;height:15.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-
align:right;" nowrap="nowrap"&gt;(61)
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.52%;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none

Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New

&lt;/td&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:10.86%;border-

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:72.18%;border-
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display:
inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Long-
term debt, less current maturities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.52%;border-
Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.52%;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:10.88%;border-
top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double 
#000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right;" nowrap="nowrap"&gt;2,376&amp;nbsp;
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.52%;border-
Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.52%;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:10.86%;border-
top:1pt solid #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double 
#000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:15.75pt;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;text-align:right;" nowrap="nowrap"&gt;946&amp;nbsp;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Unamortized debt issuance
cost at December 31, 2015 was reclassified from an asset to a reduction of long-
term debt.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;This reclassification was done to comply with ASU 
2015-03 Interest &amp;#x2013; Imputation of Interest (Subtopic 835-30): 
Simplifying the Presentation of Debt Issuance Cost. &lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;On March 28, 2016, the
Company&amp;#x2019;s senior credit facility with Prosperity Bank after 
Prosperity Bank&amp;#x2019;s most recent review of the Company&amp;#x2019;s 
currently owned producing properties was amended to decrease the 
Company&amp;#x2019;s borrowing base from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;$7.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; million to 
approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$3.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; million, extend the term 
of the facility to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;January 30,
2018&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;, and delete the Leverage 
Ratio covenant.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For the quarter ended December 31, 2015, the 
Company was in default on compliance with the Leverage Ratio 
covenant.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;In addition, the amendment also added a Debt to 
Tangible Net Worth covenant, waived the default on the Interest Coverage ratio 
for the quarter ended December 31, 2015, waived the anticipated default for the 
quarter ended March 31, 2016, and waived compliance with the Interest Coverage 
ratio for all applicable periods through the maturity 
date.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Although the Company was in default of the Leverage and
Interest Coverage ratios for the quarter ended December 31, 2015, the Company 
was in compliance at March 28, 2016 as a result of the amendment and 
waivers.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;For the quarter ended June 30, 2016, the Company was
in default on compliance with the Debt to Tangible Net Worth 
covenant.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;On August 10, 2016, the Company received a waiver 
of the covenant default for the quarter ended June 30, 2016 as well as a waiver 
for the anticipated default for the quarter ended September 30, 2016.&amp;nbsp; 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Based on additional means of 
raising capital currently being considered by the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt;Company&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;, it is&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; 
anticipate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;d&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;that the
Company&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; will be in compliance 
with this covenant for the quarter ended December 31, 
2016.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Although the Company was in default of the Debt to 
Tangible Net Worth covenant for the quarter ended June 30, 2016, the Company was
in compliance as of August 10, 2016 as a result of the 
waiver.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The borrowing base remains subject to the existing 
periodic redetermination provisions in the credit facility. The interest rate 
remained prime plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;0.50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; per 
annum.&amp;nbsp; This rate was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;4.00%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; at the date 
of the amendment.&amp;nbsp; The maximum line of credit of the Company under the 
Prosperity Bank credit facility remained &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;$40&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; 
million.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The next borrowing base review will take place in
August 2016.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
(3)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Earnings per Common Share&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;We report basic earnings 
per common share, which excludes the effect of potentially dilutive securities, 
and diluted earnings per common share which include the effect of all 
potentially dilutive securities unless their impact is anti-dilutive. The 
following are reconciliations of the numerators and denominators of our basic 
and diluted earnings per share, (in thousands except for share and per share 
amounts):&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
1pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

size:1pt;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;

top:2pt double #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double 
#000000 ;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;background-color: 
#CCEEFF;height:15.75pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;text-

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.46%;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none

#CCEEFF;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
Roman;overflow: hidden;font-size:0pt;"&gt;
&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" style="width:01.46%;border-
top:2pt double #000000 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:2pt double

#CCEEFF;height:15.75pt;padding:0pt;"&gt;

&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Share and per share data
at June 30, 2015 has been adjusted to reflect the impact of the 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt; for 10 reverse stock split approved at the 
shareholder meeting on March 21, 2016, effective with trading on March 24, 
2016.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;The total number of shares issued and outstanding 
represent estimates after adjustments to reflect the impact of the reverse stock
split.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-

&lt;/p&gt;

unitRef="Unit12" decimals="INF">1550000</us-
gaap:FairValueDisclosureOffbalanceSheetRisksFaceAmountLiability>
  <us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-
ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;
(10)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;FASB ASC 820,
&amp;#x201C;Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures&amp;#x201D;, establishes a 
framework for measuring fair value. That framework provides a fair value 
hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs to valuation techniques used to measure 
fair value. The hierarchy gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices
in active markets for identical assets and liabilities (Level 1 measurements) 
and the lowest priority to unobservable inputs (Level 3 measurements). The three
levels of the fair value hierarchy under FASB ASC 820 are described as 
follows:&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-
ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Level 1 &amp;#x2013; 
Observable inputs, such as unadjusted quoted prices in active markets, for 
substantially identical assets and liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Level 2 &amp;#x2013;
Observable inputs other than quoted prices within Level 1 for similar assets and
liabilities. These include quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in 
active markets, quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in markets 
that are not active, or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated 
by observable market data.&amp;nbsp; If the asset or liability has a specified 
or contractual term, the input must be observable for substantially the full 
term of the asset or liability.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-align:justify;text-justify:inter-
ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Level 3 &amp;#x2013;
Unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity, 
generally requiring a significant amount of judgment by management.&amp;nbsp; 
The assets or liabilities fair value measurement level within the fair value 
hierarchy is based on the lowest level of any input that is significant to the 
fair value measurement. Valuation techniques used need to maximize the use of 
observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The methods described 
above may produce a fair value calculation that may not be indicative of net 
realizable value or reflective of future fair values. Further, although the 
Company believes its valuation methods are appropriate and consistent with other
market participants, the use of different methodologies or assumptions to 
determine the fair value of certain financial instruments could result in a 
different fair value measurement at the reporting date.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Upon completion of wells,
the Company records an asset retirement obligation at fair value using Level 3 
assumptions.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;Nonfinancial assets and
liabilities are measured at fair value on a nonrecurring basis upon 
impairment.&amp;nbsp; The carrying amounts of other financial instruments 
including cash and cash equivalents, accounts receivable, account payables, 
accrued liabilities and long term debt in our balance sheet approximates fair 
value as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock>
<us-gaap:FullCostOrSuccessfulEffortsPolicy 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;Full
Cost Method of Accounting&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company follows the
full cost method of accounting for oil and gas property acquisition, 
exploration, and development activities.&amp;nbsp; Under this method, all costs 
incurred in connection with acquisition, exploration, and development of oil and
gas reserves are capitalized.&amp;nbsp; Capitalized costs include lease 
acquisition costs, seismic related costs, certain internal exploration costs, 
drilling, completion, and estimated asset retirement costs. The capitalized 
costs of oil and gas properties, plus estimated future development costs 
relating to proved reserves and estimated asset retirement costs which are not 
already included net of estimated salvage value, are amortized on the unit-of-
production method based on total proved reserves. The Company has determined its
reserves based upon reserve reports provided by LaRoche Petroleum Consultants 
Ltd.&amp;nbsp; The costs of unproved properties are excluded from amortization 
until the properties are evaluated, subject to an annual assessment of whether 
impairment has occurred.&amp;nbsp; The Company had unevaluated properties of 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;$552,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt; at June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015.&amp;nbsp; 
Proceeds from the sale of oil and gas properties are accounted for as reductions
to capitalized costs unless such sales cause a significant change in the 
relationship between costs and the estimated value of proved reserves, in which 
case a gain or loss is recognized.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;At the end of each
reporting period, the Company performs a &amp;#x201C;ceiling test&amp;#x201D; on
the value of the net capitalized cost of oil and gas properties. This test 
compares the net capitalized cost (capitalized cost of oil and gas properties, 
net of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization and related deferred
income taxes) to the present value of estimated future net revenues from oil and
gas properties using an average price (arithmetic average of the beginning of 
month prices for the prior 12 months) and current cost discounted at 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;10%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt; plus cost of properties not being amortized and the
lower of cost or estimated fair value of unproven properties included in the 
cost being amortized (ceiling).&amp;nbsp; If the net capitalized cost is greater
than the ceiling, a write-down or impairment is required.&amp;nbsp; A write-down
of the carrying value of the asset is a non-cash charge that reduces earnings in
the current period.&amp;nbsp; Once incurred, a write-down cannot be reversed in 
a later period.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;During the three months and six months ended 
June 30, 2016, the Company recorded an impairment of oil and gas properties in 
the amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$1,445,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; and 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
$2,086,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;, 
respectively.&amp;nbsp; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; impairment of 
oil and gas properties were recorded during the three months and six months 
ended June 30, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:FullCostOrSuccessfulEffortsPolicy>

  <us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016">&lt;div&gt; &lt;div style="margin-
left:0pt;margin-right:0pt;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:
10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;font-weight:bold;"&gt;
(2)&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Income Taxes&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company uses the
asset and liability method of accounting for deferred income 
taxes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are determined 
based on the temporary differences between the financial statement and tax basis
of assets and liabilities.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Deferred tax assets or liabilities
at the end of each period are determined using the tax rate in effect at that 
time.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The deferred income tax
assets or liabilities for an oil and gas exploration and development company are
dependent on many variables such as estimates of the economic lives of depleting
oil and gas reserves and commodity prices.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Accordingly, the 
asset or liability is subject to continuous recalculation, and revision of the 
numerous estimates required, and may change significantly in the event of 
occurrences such as major acquisitions, divestitures, commodity price changes, 
changes in reserve estimates, changes in reserve lives, and changes in tax rates
or tax laws.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;#xFEFF;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;The Company does not
expect to pay any federal or state income tax for the year 2016 as a result of 
net operating loss carry forwards from prior 
years.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Accounting standards require the consideration of a 
valuation allowance for deferred tax assets if it is &amp;#x201C;more likely 
than not&amp;#x201D; that some or all of the benefits of deferred tax assets 
will not be realized.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;As of June 30, 2016, the Company has 
recorded a full valuation allowance on its deferred tax 
assets.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;Based on these requirements, &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="display: inline;"&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;
provision or benefit for income taxes has been recorded for deferred 
taxes.&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;There were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: 
inline;"&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt; recorded 
unrecognized tax benefits at June 30, 2016.&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:36pt;text-align:justify;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size: 10pt"&gt;
&lt;font style="display: inline;"&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/font&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt; &lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:IncomeTaxDisclosureTextBlock>

unitRef="Unit12" decimals="-3">-380000</us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit>

  <us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit contextRef="Duration_1_1_2016_To_6_30_2016" 
unitRef="Unit12" decimals="0">0</us-gaap:IncomeTaxExpenseBenefit>
  <us-gaap:IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayable 
contextRef="Duration_1_1_2015_To_6_30_2015" unitRef="Unit12" decimals="-3">-
88000</us-gaap:IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayable>
  <us-gaap:IncreaseDecreaseInAccountsPayable
